intro: Arabis crepidiopoda, commonly known as the rock白菜, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, and it produces small, round, edible seeds. Arabis crepidiopoda is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in difficult growing conditions.
